meanings.definition: To get in the way of or prevent the progress or success of something.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally interfered with the game by standing in the middle of the field.
meanings.sent2: Please do not interfere with the experiment while it is in progress.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel decided to interfere with the bird feeder, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: His loud music interfered with my ability to concentrate on my work.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds interfered with the power lines, causing a blackout.

meanings.definition: To become involved in the activities or concerns of others without being asked or needed.
meanings.sent1: I didn't mean to interfere, but I overheard your conversation.
meanings.sent2: It's best not to interfere in matters that don't involve you.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat always finds a way to interfere with our board games.
meanings.sent4: Her well-intentioned advice ended up interfering with their decision-making process.
meanings.sent5: The nosy neighbor couldn't resist interfering in everyone's business.

meanings.definition: To tamper or meddle with something.
meanings.sent1: He likes to interfere with the settings on my phone when I'm not looking.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to interfere with evidence at a crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child decided to interfere with the cookie jar, leaving a mess.
meanings.sent4: The hacker attempted to interfere with the company's database, but was caught in time.
meanings.sent5: The artist refused to let anyone interfere with her creative process.
